metadata.title: CVE-2014-5459 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - negligible.
metadata.description: The PEAR_REST class in REST.php in PEAR in PHP through 5.6.0 allows local users to write to arbitrary files via a symlink attack on a (1) rest.cachefile or (2) rest.cacheid file in /tmp/pear/cache/, related to the retrieveCacheFirst and useLocalCache functions.

notes.note: jdstrand> Upstream states this is a known issue sbeattie> upstream claims fixed in 1.9.2, but still uses /tmp/pear/ according to debian bug report mdeslaur> 1.9.2+ only a DoS

criterions.comment: php-pear package in hirsute is affected and needs fixing.
